comments:
The Web Libraries dependancies settings in the project properties of a Web module blocks export if you add a workspace jar. To reproduce:
  1) Create a simple project and put a jar file inside.
  2) Create a web module and add the jar file as a web library dependancy.
  3) Try to export the WAR.

Problem discussed briefly with John. Here are the issues I found:
  * Once a workspace jar has been added, WAR export will fail with the stack trace shown below.
  * The Deselect button does not work. It deselects the checkbox, but they are still selected if you reopen the dialog.
  * Individual deselection works in most cases, but I have found a couple times where even this did not work. The modules remained listed in the .components file until I played around with adding a new external jar and then deselecting it.
  * Dialog allows you to easily add jars from within the parent EAR - would be nice if it warned the user that this is duplication and just put it on the classpath by default.

The export and addition of workspace jars will be fixed by 138474.

This leaves the following bugs:

 The Deselect button does not work. It deselects the checkbox, but they are
still selected if you reopen the dialog.
  * Individual deselection works in most cases, but I have found a couple times
where even this did not work. The modules remained listed in the .components
file until I played around with adding a new external jar and then deselecting
it.
  * Dialog allows you to easily add jars from within the parent EAR - would be
nice if it warned the user that this is duplication and just put it on the
classpath by default.

Rob, I believe you own this properties UI code?  If not, please send to Neeraj.
Neeraj has been handling the relevant code in this case - sending your way, Neeraj

Created an attachment (id=42666)
fix for select/deselect buttons not working.

The selection button was also not working in this case. The problem was that we were not registering the fact that a change has occured, when the check boxes were changed via the select/deselect buttons.

Fixed.
Patch reviewed and released for WTP 1.5 RC4 052606 driver.
